programme.title: Goal! The Dream Begins
programme.desc: A Mexican living in Los Angeles dreams of becoming a professional footballer - and his wish seems to come true when a talent scout offers him the chance to play for Newcastle United. Unfortunately, the pressures of the Premier League and adapting to a new life in Britain prove harder than expected. Drama, starring Kuno Becker and Anna Friel. David Beckham, Alan Shearer and Zinedine Zidane make cameo appearances.(n)

programme.title: Pele: Birth Of A Legend
programme.desc: Biopic charting the meteoric rise of Brazilian football great Pele - from the slums of Sao Paulo to World Cup glory. Starring Kevin de Paula, Vincent D'Onofrio and Rodrigo Santoro.(n)

programme.title: The Swan Princess
programme.desc: A prince and princess have been expected to marry each other all their lives, a prospect they dreaded as children but which they came to look forward to as adults. However, an evil wizard captures the princess and turns her into a swan. Everyone else believes she is dead, but her betrothed sets out to bring her home. Animated adventure, with the voices of Michelle Nicastro, Jack Palance and John Cleese.(n)

programme.title: We Still Steal the Old Way
programme.desc: After their exploits in We Still Kill the Old Way, criminal outfit the Archer Gang encounters an old enemy when a daring heist ends with them behind bars. Prison drama, starring Ian Ogilvy, Billy Murray and Lysette Anthony.

programme.title: Collateral Damage
programme.desc: A heroic firefighter is plunged into the world of international terrorism when his wife and child are killed in a horrific attack. Disillusioned with the progress of the official investigation, he decides to take on the villains himself and heads for Colombia on a dangerous mission of revenge, determined to bring the perpetrators to justice. Action thriller, starring Arnold Schwarzenegger, Francesca Neri, Elias Koteas and Cliff Curtis.

programme.title: 10 Cent Pistol
programme.desc: A pair of low-life criminal brothers target the powerful LA mobster who left one of them rotting in prison. Crime caper, starring Jena Malone and Joe Mantegna.

programme.title: Sam Churchill: Search for a Homeless Man
programme.desc: A seemingly straightforward missing persons case draws a private investigator into a battle against the members of a child pornography ring, who are holding a teenager he has been hired to find. Thriller, starring John Schneider, Robyn Lively, Alex Rocco and Rudy Ramos.

programme.title: Southern Fury
programme.desc: When his brother falls foul of a ruthless mobster, a straight-laced man calls on his old friend and cop to help out. Crime thriller, starring Adrian Grenier, John Cusack and Nicolas Cage.

programme.title: The Infiltrator
programme.desc: During the 1980s, a chameleonic US agent faces one of the most dangerous assignments of his life when he infiltrates the intricate criminal network of drug kingpin Pablo Escobar. Drama, starring Bryan Cranston, John Leguizamo and Diane Kruger.

programme.title: Level Up
programme.desc: A man is forced to deliver a mysterious package across London for criminals who are holding his girlfriend hostage. Action thriller, starring Josh Bowman, Neil Maskell and William Houston.

programme.title: Jack Reacher: Never Go Back
programme.desc: When the commander of his old military unit is arrested on trumped-up spy charges, vigilante Jack Reacher investigates. Action sequel, starring Tom Cruise, Cobie Smulders and Danika Yarosh.

programme.title: Shot Caller
programme.desc: An ex con is forced by the leaders of his gang to orchestrate a major crime with a brutal rival squad on the streets of Southern California. Crime drama, starring Jon Bernthal, Nikolaj Coster-Waldau and Lake Bell.

programme.title: Unforgettable
programme.desc: A woman sets out to make life a living hell for her ex-husband's new fiancee. Thriller, starring Rosario Dawson, Katherine Heigl and Geoff Stults.

programme.title: Vanilla Sky
programme.desc: The laid-back lifestyle of an arrogant New York playboy is shattered when his unstable girlfriend drives off a bridge with him in the car. Although he survives, he struggles to put his life back together in the face of a series of strange events. Cameron Crowe's remake of Spanish thriller Open Your Eyes, starring Tom Cruise, Cameron Diaz, Kurt Russell, Jason Lee and Penelope Cruz, who also appeared in the original.

programme.title: Jack Reacher: Never Go Back
programme.desc: When the commander of his old military unit is arrested on trumped-up spy charges, vigilante Jack Reacher investigates. Action sequel, starring Tom Cruise, Cobie Smulders and Danika Yarosh.

programme.title: Shot Caller
programme.desc: An ex con is forced by the leaders of his gang to orchestrate a major crime with a brutal rival squad on the streets of Southern California. Crime drama, starring Jon Bernthal, Nikolaj Coster-Waldau and Lake Bell.

programme.title: The Krays
programme.desc: Biopic of the infamous twin brothers who built up a criminal empire in the East End of London during the 1960s. Seizing territory from an already established rival by force, they quickly rose to prominence in the city's gangland culture. However, over time the brothers began to clash, while enemies stood ready to bring them down. Starring Gary and Martin Kemp, Billie Whitelaw and Tom Bell.

programme.title: The International
programme.desc: An Interpol agent and a district attorney discover a major international bank is involved in a vast range of illegal activities, from insider trading to arms deals and bringing down governments. As they battle to expose the truth, they find the corrupt organisation not only has the law on its side, but will kill to keep the secrets safe. Thriller, starring Clive Owen and Naomi Watts.

programme.title: Deep Family Secrets
programme.desc: A girl sets out on a personal quest to discover the truth about her mother's alleged abduction, and uncovers a tangled tale of adultery, incest and murder. Thriller, starring Richard Crenna, Angie Dickinson and Meg Foster.

programme.title: Come And Find Me
programme.desc: A man's desperate search for his missing girlfriend takes him down an increasingly dark and dangerous path. Mystery thriller, starring Aaron Paul, Annabelle Wallis and Garret Dillahunt.

programme.title: Detour
programme.desc: A troubled LA law student drunkenly commits to a revenge plot against his stepfather. Crime thriller, starring Tye Sheridan, Emory Cohen and Bel Powley.

programme.title: Refuge
programme.desc: A family fight to stay alive in a post-apocalyptic world where disease has wiped out almost the entire population. Survival thriller, starring Carter Roy, Amy Rutberg and Sebastian Beacon.

programme.title: Contraband
programme.desc: Successful international smuggler Chris Farraday turns his back on a life of crime to raise a family. However, his brother-in-law crosses a powerful drug lord, who forces Chris to transport billions of dollars of counterfeit money into the US, or his wife and children will be killed. Crime thriller, starring Mark Wahlberg, Kate Beckinsale, Giovanni Ribisi and Ben Foster.

programme.title: The Hatton Garden Job
programme.desc: A ragtag group of career criminals plot an audacious, multi-million-pound raid on an underground facility in London. True-life crime drama, with Stephen Moyer, Larry Lamb and Matthew Goode.

programme.title: Phone Booth
programme.desc: A smart-mouthed PR executive answers a public phone and the caller on the other end warns him that if he hangs up he will be shot. The unseen gunman then puts his target through a tortuous series of mind games, as well as incriminating him in the death of a bystander. Psychological thriller, starring Colin Farrell, Kiefer Sutherland, Katie Holmes and Forest Whitaker.

programme.title: Dick Tracy
programme.desc: An incorruptible Chicago cop launches a relentless campaign to stop a ruthless gangster plotting to take control of the city. But the detective finds himself distracted by the attentions of a seductive nightclub singer and a faceless vigilante playing both sides against the middle. Comic-strip adventure, directed by and starring Warren Beatty, with Madonna, Al Pacino and Dustin Hoffman.

programme.title: Contraband
programme.desc: Successful international smuggler Chris Farraday turns his back on a life of crime to raise a family. However, his brother-in-law crosses a powerful drug lord, who forces Chris to transport billions of dollars of counterfeit money into the US, or his wife and children will be killed. Crime thriller, starring Mark Wahlberg, Kate Beckinsale, Giovanni Ribisi and Ben Foster.

programme.title: Brawl In Cell Block 99
programme.desc: A former boxer is blackmailed into performing a prison hit by a ruthless drug kingpin. Crime thriller, starring Vince Vaughn, Jennifer Carpenter and Don Johnson.

programme.title: Vantage Point
programme.desc: An assassination attempt is made on the life of the US president during a terrorism summit. The story unfolds from several perspectives, including that of the secret service agents charged with protecting the head of state, a news producer covering the event and a man in the crowd who may have caught the perpetrator on camera. Thriller, starring Dennis Quaid, Matthew Fox, Forest Whitaker, Sigourney Weaver and William Hurt.

programme.title: Mississippi Burning
programme.desc: Two mismatched FBI agents, one a tough former sheriff, the other a by-the-book idealist, are sent to a small town in the Deep South to investigate the disappearance of three civil rights activists, only to come up against a conspiracy of silence. Alan Parker's drama set in the 1960s, starring Gene Hackman, Willem Dafoe, Brad Dourif, Michael Rooker, R Lee Ermey and Frances McDormand.(n)

programme.title: Let Me Make You a Martyr
programme.desc: Two siblings hatch a plan to take out their father, only for him to put a hitman on their tail. Revenge drama, starring Mark Boone Junior, Marilyn Manson and Sam Quartin.(n)

programme.title: Angel Flight Down
programme.desc: A mercy mission runs into difficulty when the plane commissioned to airlift a sick girl suffers engine trouble and crashes on the edge of a cliff. Drama, starring Patricia Kalember and David Charvet.(n)

programme.title: Hijacked
programme.desc: FBI agent Gretchen Blair finds herself caught in the middle of an elaborate mid-air heist. Thriller, starring Denise Richards, Dolph Lundgren and Chuck Liddell.(n)

programme.title: The Sting
programme.desc: Two conmen decide to swindle a mobster out of a fortune in revenge for the murder of a mutual friend. Enlisting the help of a host of crooks, they quickly conjure up a brilliant scheme to make him pay for his crime. Oscar-winning Depression-era comedy drama, starring Robert Redford, Paul Newman, Robert Shaw, Charles Durning and Eileen Brennan.(n)

programme.title: The Firm
programme.desc: Harvard law graduate Mitch is headhunted to work for a prestigious law firm, despite his wife's warnings that it is too good to be true. After two of his colleagues are murdered, Mitch is approached by the FBI and informed the company is controlled by the Mafia - leaving him in a deadly predicament. Thriller, adapted from the novel by John Grisham, starring Tom Cruise, Gene Hackman, Jeanne Tripplehorn and Holly Hunter.(n)

programme.title: Identity
programme.desc: Ten strangers take shelter from a storm in a remote hotel, but start to suspect their being together at the same place and time is more than just a coincidence. Before long a mysterious figure begins to murder them off one by one - leaving the guests to work out which of them is the killer, or if someone else is in the hotel. Murder mystery, starring John Cusack, Ray Liotta, Amanda Peet and Alfred Molina.(n)

programme.title: Eliminators
programme.desc: A former federal agent in the witness protection programme is forced to come out of hiding and go on the run. Thriller, starring Scott Adkins, Stu Bennett and Daniel Caltagirone.(n)

programme.title: Inferno
programme.desc: Robert Langdon awakes with amnesia in an Italian hospital, and is soon on the run with a beautiful doctor. Racing to stop a devastating virus, the Da Vinci Code expert suffers shocking visions as an assassin closes in. Thriller, starring Tom Hanks, Felicity Jones and Irrfan Khan.(n)

programme.title: The Sting
programme.desc: Two conmen decide to swindle a mobster out of a fortune in revenge for the murder of a mutual friend. Enlisting the help of a host of crooks, they quickly conjure up a brilliant scheme to make him pay for his crime. Oscar-winning Depression-era comedy drama, starring Robert Redford, Paul Newman, Robert Shaw, Charles Durning and Eileen Brennan.(n)

programme.title: The Firm
programme.desc: Harvard law graduate Mitch is headhunted to work for a prestigious law firm, despite his wife's warnings that it is too good to be true. After two of his colleagues are murdered, Mitch is approached by the FBI and informed the company is controlled by the Mafia - leaving him in a deadly predicament. Thriller, adapted from the novel by John Grisham, starring Tom Cruise, Gene Hackman, Jeanne Tripplehorn and Holly Hunter.(n)

programme.title: Identity
programme.desc: Ten strangers take shelter from a storm in a remote hotel, but start to suspect their being together at the same place and time is more than just a coincidence. Before long a mysterious figure begins to murder them off one by one - leaving the guests to work out which of them is the killer, or if someone else is in the hotel. Murder mystery, starring John Cusack, Ray Liotta, Amanda Peet and Alfred Molina.(n)

programme.title: Red State
programme.desc: Three teenagers are lured to a remote area by an online offer of sex, only to fall into the clutches of a fanatical Christian sect. The preacher leading the group is on a mission to kill all those he judges as sinners, but his actions have been noticed by the local sheriff, and the church is soon under siege by federal agents. Thriller, starring Michael Parks and John Goodman.

programme.title: Stalag 17
programme.desc: The inmates of a German PoW camp are convinced there is a traitor in their midst when the guards seem to be forewarned of their escape attempts. An unassuming sergeant content to remain a captive until the end of the conflict becomes the focus of suspicion as mob mentality takes hold. Billy Wilder's Second World War drama, starring an Oscar-winning William Holden, with Don Taylor, Otto Preminger and Harvey Lembeck.

programme.title: The Devil at 4 O'Clock
programme.desc: A priest is sent to a South Seas island to replace a drunken missionary, who has been relieved of his duties. Sharing his flight are three convicts being sent to work at a children's leper hospital. The five men must work together to protect the young patients when a volcano erupts, leaving them stranded with no easy way out. Adventure, starring Spencer Tracy, Frank Sinatra and Kerwin Mathews.

programme.title: The Train
programme.desc: As the Allies look set to liberate Paris from the Nazi forces, the Germans resolve to take all they can from the city - and plot to transport national treasures back to Berlin. However, bold French Resistance forces vow to stop them, enlisting the help of a train inspector along the way. Second World War adventure, starring Burt Lancaster, Paul Scofield, Jeanne Moreau and Michel Simon.

programme.title: Taxi
programme.desc: A bumbling New York cop is unable to pursue a gang of bank robbers in their souped-up getaway car because he does not have a driving licence. Fortunately, help is on hand in the form of a taxi driver with dreams of becoming a racing driver, and whose customised cab is the fastest in New York. Comedy adventure remake, starring Queen Latifah, Jimmy Fallon and Gisele Bundchen.

programme.title: Die Hard
programme.desc: New York cop John McClane visits Los Angeles to see his family over the Christmas holiday. Stopping off at his wife's place of work, he realises armed men have taken over the building and are holding the corporation's staff to ransom - and only he has the ability to fight back. Action thriller, starring Bruce Willis, Alan Rickman and Bonnie Bedelia.

programme.title: Mercury Rising
programme.desc: A top-secret government agency has developed a seemingly unbreakable code - only for an autistic boy to crack it in an instant. Assassins succeed in gunning down his parents, but a maverick FBI agent investigating their deaths finds the child hiding in a closet, and resolves to shield him from the hitmen on his trail. Thriller, starring Bruce Willis, Alec Baldwin and Miko Hughes.

programme.title: Mental
programme.desc: A philandering politician has his wife committed to a mental hospital, then covers it up by claiming she is on holiday. Unable to cope with raising five demanding teenage daughters by himself, he hires a live-in nanny - an eccentric hitch-hiker who attempts to boost the girls' confidence in a number of bizarre ways. Comedy, starring Toni Collette, Anthony LaPaglia and Liev Schreiber.

programme.title: Halls of Montezuma
programme.desc: A US marine unit fighting in the Pacific is ordered to capture Japanese troops so they can be interrogated for information about a new weapons base - but the mission proves even more difficult than expected. Second World War adventure, starring Richard Widmark, Jack Palance, Reginald Gardiner, Robert Wagner and Karl Malden.

programme.title: The Man from Laramie
programme.desc: A cavalry officer determines to avenge the death of his brother, but rather than target the Apaches who killed him, he vows to go after the gang who supplied them with their weapons - leading to conflict with the sadistic son of an elderly rancher. Anthony Mann's Western, starring James Stewart, Arthur Kennedy, Donald Crisp and Cathy O'Donnell.

programme.title: The Bravados
programme.desc: A widower visits a town where the men he believes murdered his wife are about to be hanged. When they escape from jail, he takes the law into his own hands and decides to hunt down and kill the fugitives. But over time, he begins to question whether his actions are right. Western, starring Gregory Peck, Joan Collins and Stephen Boyd.

programme.title: The Tall T
programme.desc: A ranch hand hitches a ride on a stagecoach after losing his horse, but things go from bad to worse when the vehicle is hijacked by outlaws. The cowboy tries to bargain for the release of his fellow hostages - a newlywed couple - but his pleas fall on stony ground once the bandit leader learns the new bride is a rich heiress. Western, with Randolph Scott, Richard Boone, Maureen O'Sullivan and Henry Silva.

programme.title: Ride Along
programme.desc: A wannabe police officer persuades his girlfriend's tough detective brother to take him along on duty. The cop hopes to scare his unwanted partner away from his sister by exposing him to danger - but needs some help when the patrol leads to a run-in with the city's most wanted criminal. Comedy, starring Ice Cube, Kevin Hart and Laurence Fishburne.

programme.title: The Purge
programme.desc: The American government responds to rising crime rates by introducing an annual 12-hour period when all laws are suspended, so the people can get violent impulses out of their system. A family takes shelter at home, but when a stranger turns up asking for help, the mayhem outside soon catches up with them. Horror, starring Lena Headey and Ethan Hawke.

programme.title: The Purge: Anarchy
programme.desc: A woman, her daughter and a couple are lost on the streets during a dangerous annual night when all laws are suspended. A gun-toting loner comes to their aid and fights to protect them, while also plotting to take advantage of the situation to pursue a murderous mission of his own. Horror sequel, starring Frank Grillo and Carmen Ejogo.

programme.title: Eden
programme.desc: Premiere. A literature student abandons his thesis as his DJing career takes off, achieving success in US clubs, but his spending and cocaine habit start catching up with him. Drama, starring Felix de Givry and Pauline Etienne. In French and English.(n)

programme.title: Night Passage
programme.desc: The black sheep of a family falls in with a gang of outlaws plotting to rob a train operated by his strait-laced brother, but reckons without his sibling's determination to track him down and set him back on the straight and narrow. Western, starring James Stewart, Audie Murphy, Dan Duryea and Brandon de Wilde.(n)

programme.title: Summer Holiday
programme.desc: Four mechanics embark on a fun-filled trip across Europe on board a double-decker London bus, and enjoy all manner of romantic adventures with three young women who hitch a ride on their way to Athens. However, an unexpected stowaway causes a few surprises. Musical comedy, starring Cliff Richard, Lauri Peters, Melvyn Hayes, Una Stubbs, Ron Moody and the Shadows.(n)

programme.title: Earth vs the Flying Saucers
programme.desc: Aliens arrive on Earth with an ultimatum - surrender or face death - prompting humanity to pull out all the stops to find a way of defeating the extraterrestrial menace. Sci-fi drama, starring Hugh Marlowe, Joan Taylor, Donald Curtis and Morris Ankrum, with special effects by Ray Harryhausen.(n)

programme.title: Drums Along the Mohawk
programme.desc: Settlers find the dream of starting a new life in a remote valley threatened when the American War of Independence breaks out. They soon come under threat both from British forces and a Mohawk tribe angry at intruders in its territory. John Ford's historical drama, starring Henry Fonda and Claudette Colbert.(n)

programme.title: The River Wild
programme.desc: A headstrong white-water rafting expert embarks on a holiday with her family, but their fun comes to an abrupt end when two killers show up. The fugitives' only escape route from the law is down a raging river, so they take the woman and her son hostage to act as guides. Meanwhile, her husband desperately tries to keep track from the riverbank, waiting for his opportunity to launch a rescue attempt. Action thriller, starring Meryl Streep, Kevin Bacon, David Strathairn, Joseph Mazzello and John C Reilly.(n)

programme.title: Taken 3
programme.desc: Ex-CIA agent Bryan Mills' efforts to finally live a quiet life are shattered by the death of his ex-wife. Just when things seemingly can't get any worse, he is framed for her murder and must fight to clear his name. Action thriller sequel, starring Liam Neeson, Forest Whitaker and Maggie Grace.(n)

programme.title: Conan the Barbarian
programme.desc: An evil warlord kills a barbarian chieftain, whose son grows up to be a mighty warrior and seeks revenge for his father's death. He finds there is more at stake, as the tyrant is close to acquiring all the pieces of a magic mask, which will make him all-powerful. Fantasy adventure, with Jason Momoa, Stephen Lang, Ron Perlman and Rose McGowan.(n)

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: An eerie atmosphere descends over the household as Olivia recalls the strange events that followed the death of a childhood friend.

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: John-Boy returns his new high-school graduation suit so the family can afford to buy a new cow when Chance dies. Richard Thomas and Ralph Waite star.

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.desc: Charles rushes Mary to an eye specialist, elated to discover she can tell light from dark, but Adam is less enthusiastic about her exciting revelation.

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.desc: Charles discovers that he has become a target for the affections of a lonely woman and her two children.

programme.title: Providence
programme.desc: Syd moves house, while Heather's engagement provokes an argument with her mother, who very definitely disapproves - and poor old Robbie finds himself caught in the crossfire. Victoria Principal guest stars.

programme.title: Providence
programme.desc: Syd treats a woman whose mother, grandmother and sister all suffered breast cancer and is prepared to undergo radical surgery to avoid the same fate. Victoria Principal guest stars.

programme.title: Highway to Heaven
programme.desc: Jonathan is reunited with his wife from his life as a human, and has to help her move on from him and make a fresh start.

programme.title: Highway to Heaven
programme.desc: Jonathan meets a fellow angel who has been on probation for 200 years, and cannot stop himself breaking the rules when he should be spreading happiness. Edward Asner guest stars.

programme.title: Love Takes Wing
programme.desc: A doctor takes up a new position in a small frontier town, where a mysterious illness is afflicting the residents. The medic takes desperate measures to stop the infection spreading, but also has to convince suspicious townsfolk that a local orphanage is not the source of the disease. Drama, starring Sarah Jones, Haylie Duff, Patrick Duffy and Cloris Leachman.

programme.title: Breach of Trust
programme.desc: A woman is devastated to learn a plane on which her husband was travelling has crashed, leaving him in a coma. However, the disaster leads to the revelation that he has been conducting a secret relationship with another woman, who did not survive the crash. What's more, they had a daughter. Drama, starring Roma Downey, William Russ and Jamie Rose.

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: The Waltons visit the seashore and stay at the Baldwin's beach home, to find an English girl staying there with a troubled past. Meanwhile, Ben stays home, hoping to enjoy some time alone.

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.desc: Mr Edwards finds that John prefers reading to hunting, and hopes to modify his adopted son's sensitive behaviour by buying him a rifle. Victor French stars.

programme.title: Love and Hate: The Story of Colin and JoAnn Thatcher
programme.desc: Part one of two. Fact-based courtroom drama about the conviction of Canadian millionaire rancher and politician Colin Thatcher for the murder of his ex-wife. Kate Nelligan, Kenneth Walsh and John Colicos star.

programme.title: Love and Hate: The Story of Colin and JoAnn Thatcher
programme.desc: Part two of two. A woman endures years of abuse from her wealthy politician husband. But worse is to come after a fierce custody battle for their children. Drama, starring Kate Nelligan and Kenneth Welsh.

programme.title: Joan of Arc
programme.desc: The first of a two-part drama. A young French girl experiences religious visions, convincing her she has been sent by God to unite her countrymen under the rule of King Charles. In the heat of battle, however, she is captured, and sold to the English enemy. Historical drama, starring Leelee Sobieski, Jacqueline Bissett, Powers Boothe, Olympia Dukakis, Shirley MacLaine and Peter O'Toole.

programme.title: The Eichmann Show
programme.desc: Fact-based drama telling the story of American producer Milton Fruchtman and blacklisted documentary film-maker Leo Hurwitz, who overcame enormous obstacles to record the trial of Nazi war criminal Adolf Eichmann, one of the major organisers of the Holocaust. Footage of his trial in Jerusalem in 1961, was broadcast in 37 countries and was the first time survivors had spoken about the horrors of the concentration camps to a mass audience. Martin Freeman and Anthony LaPaglia star, with Rebecca Front.

programme.title: The Stalker's Apprentice
programme.desc: Drama, starring Gideon Turner as lovelorn Marcus Walwyn, whose imagination is sent into overdrive by the receipt of a mysterious manuscript, turning his casual interest in acquaintance Karen Scott into a full-blown fatal attraction. With Peter Davison, James Bolam, Natalie Walter and Guy Leverton.

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: A travelling salesman convinces the family to part with their hard-earned cash and buy a small library's worth of novels, essays and poems. But when the books fail to arrive, they soon begin to wonder if he is really a conman.

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: John-Boy agrees to work for a local man in exchange for a car, but ends up being taken for a ride when the scoundrel reneges on the deal.

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.desc: Anthrax strikes Walnut Grove, so Charles and Mr Garvey visit Springfield to pick up medical supplies. On the way back, a man holds them up and steals their wagon.

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.desc: Terminally ill Dylan Whittaker's greatest wish is to see the ocean, and he seeks Albert's help in fulfilling his dream before he dies.

programme.title: Providence
programme.desc: Donna and Robbie make plans to disrupt Heather and Charlie's wedding and Syd helps an apparently destitute man, little suspecting he is a cunning con artist. Mike Farrell stars.

programme.title: Providence
programme.desc: A storm hits Providence, while Syd's medical practice faces problems as a leaky roof interferes with her efforts to save the life of a pregnant woman.

programme.title: Highway to Heaven
programme.desc: A man tries to persuade his neighbours to help him build a memorial to his son, who was killed in the Vietnam war. Eli Wallach guest stars.

programme.title: Highway to Heaven
programme.desc: Mark believes he is responsible for two tragedies, and pleads with Jonathan to change history.

programme.title: Daniel's Daughter
programme.desc: A magazine editor receives news of her estranged father's death, and agrees to fulfil his final wish to scatter his ashes at the family's old home, an undertaking forces her to confront the past she left behind. Drama, starring Laura Leighton, London Angelis, Martin Doyle, Brandon Firla and Dorly Jean-Louis.

programme.title: Saigon, Year of the Cat
programme.desc: A British banker working in Saigon during the last days of the Vietnam war becomes increasingly attracted to a CIA operative, and the ensuing affair gives her an insight into how out of their depth the American forces really are. Stephen Frears' romantic drama, starring Judi Dench, Frederic Forrest, Roger Rees, Wallace Shawn, Josef Sommer and EG Marshall.

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: John and Olivia must accept that Erin is growing up when GW Haines proposes marriage. However, when she turns down her boyfriend's proposal, GW elects to join the army.

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.desc: Laura is attracted to a new boy in school, but Nellie is equally keen on him, and plans to ruin their romance.

programme.title: No One Would Tell
programme.desc: A shy teenager thinks all her dreams have come true when the school's star athlete asks her out. However, the relationship soon turns sour as her seemingly perfect boyfriend becomes possessive, controlling and violent. Drama, starring Fred Savage, Candace Cameron Bure, Gregory Alan Williams and Rodney Eastman.

programme.title: Vanished Without a Trace
programme.desc: A distraught mother swears to exact an appropriate revenge on the thug responsible for kidnapping and killing her teenage daughter. Crime drama, starring Shelley Long, William R Moses and Jennifer Jostyn.

programme.title: Joan of Arc
programme.desc: Conclusion of the epic adventure. In the heat of battle the French heroine is captured, and sold to the English enemy. Conclusion of the epic adventure, starring Leelee Sobieski, Jacqueline Bissett, Powers Boothe, Olympia Dukakis, Shirley MacLaine and Peter O'Toole.

programme.title: This Sporting Life
programme.desc: A successful rugby league player's arrogant and aggressive behaviour undermines his fragile relationship with an emotionally repressed widow. As their affair comes to a bitter end, he devotes himself to the game, but the exploitation he and his fellow players endure takes its toll. Lindsay Anderson's drama, starring Richard Harris, Rachel Roberts, Alan Badel, William Hartnell, Colin Blakely and Arthur Lowe.

programme.title: Taggart
programme.desc: A gambler is found kicked to death - and despite the fact that he was unemployed, the team find wads of cash hidden in his flat. The discovery raises suspicions that he was involved in an illegal betting syndicate at a local stable - where a second death only serves to raise the stakes.

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: Part one of two. The family help their relatives to make a stand against the authorities, following the issuing of an eviction notice.(n)

programme.title: The Waltons

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.desc: Part one of two. Laura Ingalls attempts to prove her feelings for Almanzo Wilder are real, but faces competition from love rival Nellie Oleson. Drama, starring Melissa Gilbert.(n)

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.desc: Part two of two. Charlie makes a mistake as Laura and Nellie continue their battle to win the affections of Almanzo Wilder. Drama, starring Michael Landon.(n)

programme.title: Providence
programme.desc: The Hansen clan throw a surprise party for Jim's 60th birthday and try to talk him out of retiring while Syd is asked to perform ritual surgery so a man can convert to Judaism.(n)

programme.title: Providence
programme.desc: Robbie fills in for Heather at the clinic and Syd attempts to bring about a reconcilation between a pregnant woman and her estranged family.(n)

programme.title: Highway to Heaven
programme.desc: Jonathan reunites a woman with the son she was forced to abandon in Russia during the Second World War - but he questions the angel's motives for wanting to help them.(n)

programme.title: Highway to Heaven
programme.desc: A survivor of the Holocaust is forced to relive his past when he and his grandson are attacked by a neo-Nazi gang.(n)

programme.title: Too Young to Marry
programme.desc: When high school students Jessica and Max announce they plan to marry, their decision is met with objections from friends and family who feel they're rushing into things. The couple remain determined to carve out a successful life for themselves, but when Jessica is accepted at Harvard University, she faces a dilemma. Romantic drama, starring Nina Dobrev and Dillon Casey.(n)

programme.title: The Wronged Man
programme.desc: A lawyer develops an interest in the case of a man sentenced to life imprisonment for rape, and comes to believe that he is innocent. She offers to represent him in court free of charge, and spends the next 22 years spearheading a campaign to clear his name. Fact-based drama, starring Julia Ormond and Mahershala Ali.(n)

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: Part one of two. Mary Ellen prepares to give birth, and Jason encounters financial difficulties that force him to look for work elsewhere.(n)

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.desc: Mary is chosen to compete in a state maths contest, but learns she cannot afford to go. American Western drama, starring Melissa Sue Anderson.(n)

programme.title: Menu for Murder

programme.title: A Question of Guilt
programme.desc: A divorcee's hedonistic lifestyle is greeted with disapproval, and the weight of public opinion swings against her when she is accused of murdering her children. Courtroom drama, starring Tuesday Weld and Ron Leibman.(n)

programme.title: The Great Los Angeles Earthquake
programme.desc: Part one. Disaster drama, starring Joanna Kerns as a pioneering seismologist who predicts an earthquake is about to strike LA, sending god-fearing citizens into a blind panic as they scramble to avoid the inevitable death and destruction. Also starring Dan Lauria, Ed Begley Jnr and Richard Masur.(n)

programme.title: The Score
programme.desc: A safecracker comes dangerously close to getting caught red-handed, so decides the time has come to quit his life of crime. However, an old friend soon tempts him back with the chance to steal a priceless French artefact being stored in a customs house, and he joins forces with a talented young thief to carry out one last heist. Crime thriller, starring Robert De Niro, Edward Norton, Marlon Brando and Angela Bassett.(n)

programme.title: Taggart
programme.desc: Ex-convict Eddie Monroe, a loner seeking to make amends for his shady past, is found stabbed to death in a Govan alleyway. Burke develops a growing conviction that retired policeman Angus Ford is somehow involved in the murder - but in the course of uncovering the truth, he is forced to confront demons of his own. Drama, starring Blythe Duff and John Michie.(n)

programme.title: Dangerous Offender: The Marlene Moore Story
programme.desc: A woman abused by her family grows up to carry out a series of minor offences and self-destructive acts. Her multiple crimes lead to her being convicted under a law to prevent repeat offences that allows for an indefinite prison sentence - the first time this had ever been used on a female defendant. Fact-based drama, starring Brooke Johnson and Robert Joy.

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: An eerie atmosphere descends over the household as Olivia recalls the strange events that followed the death of a childhood friend.

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: John-Boy returns his new high-school graduation suit so the family can afford to buy a new cow when Chance dies. Richard Thomas and Ralph Waite star.

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.desc: Charles rushes Mary to an eye specialist, elated to discover she can tell light from dark, but Adam is less enthusiastic about her exciting revelation.

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.desc: Charles discovers that he has become a target for the affections of a lonely woman and her two children.

programme.title: Providence
programme.desc: Syd moves house, while Heather's engagement provokes an argument with her mother, who very definitely disapproves - and poor old Robbie finds himself caught in the crossfire. Victoria Principal guest stars.

programme.title: Providence
programme.desc: Syd treats a woman whose mother, grandmother and sister all suffered breast cancer and is prepared to undergo radical surgery to avoid the same fate. Victoria Principal guest stars.

programme.title: Highway to Heaven
programme.desc: Jonathan is reunited with his wife from his life as a human, and has to help her move on from him and make a fresh start.

programme.title: Highway to Heaven
programme.desc: Jonathan meets a fellow angel who has been on probation for 200 years, and cannot stop himself breaking the rules when he should be spreading happiness. Edward Asner guest stars.

programme.title: Love Takes Wing
programme.desc: A doctor takes up a new position in a small frontier town, where a mysterious illness is afflicting the residents. The medic takes desperate measures to stop the infection spreading, but also has to convince suspicious townsfolk that a local orphanage is not the source of the disease. Drama, starring Sarah Jones, Haylie Duff, Patrick Duffy and Cloris Leachman.

programme.title: Breach of Trust
programme.desc: A woman is devastated to learn a plane on which her husband was travelling has crashed, leaving him in a coma. However, the disaster leads to the revelation that he has been conducting a secret relationship with another woman, who did not survive the crash. What's more, they had a daughter. Drama, starring Roma Downey, William Russ and Jamie Rose.

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: The Waltons visit the seashore and stay at the Baldwin's beach home, to find an English girl staying there with a troubled past. Meanwhile, Ben stays home, hoping to enjoy some time alone.

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.desc: Mr Edwards finds that John prefers reading to hunting, and hopes to modify his adopted son's sensitive behaviour by buying him a rifle. Victor French stars.

programme.title: Love and Hate: The Story of Colin and JoAnn Thatcher
programme.desc: Part one of two. Fact-based courtroom drama about the conviction of Canadian millionaire rancher and politician Colin Thatcher for the murder of his ex-wife. Kate Nelligan, Kenneth Walsh and John Colicos star.

programme.title: Love and Hate: The Story of Colin and JoAnn Thatcher
programme.desc: Part two of two. A woman endures years of abuse from her wealthy politician husband. But worse is to come after a fierce custody battle for their children. Drama, starring Kate Nelligan and Kenneth Welsh.

programme.title: Joan of Arc
programme.desc: The first of a two-part drama. A young French girl experiences religious visions, convincing her she has been sent by God to unite her countrymen under the rule of King Charles. In the heat of battle, however, she is captured, and sold to the English enemy. Historical drama, starring Leelee Sobieski, Jacqueline Bissett, Powers Boothe, Olympia Dukakis, Shirley MacLaine and Peter O'Toole.

programme.title: The Eichmann Show
programme.desc: Fact-based drama telling the story of American producer Milton Fruchtman and blacklisted documentary film-maker Leo Hurwitz, who overcame enormous obstacles to record the trial of Nazi war criminal Adolf Eichmann, one of the major organisers of the Holocaust. Footage of his trial in Jerusalem in 1961, was broadcast in 37 countries and was the first time survivors had spoken about the horrors of the concentration camps to a mass audience. Martin Freeman and Anthony LaPaglia star, with Rebecca Front.

programme.title: The Stalker's Apprentice
programme.desc: Drama, starring Gideon Turner as lovelorn Marcus Walwyn, whose imagination is sent into overdrive by the receipt of a mysterious manuscript, turning his casual interest in acquaintance Karen Scott into a full-blown fatal attraction. With Peter Davison, James Bolam, Natalie Walter and Guy Leverton.

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: A travelling salesman convinces the family to part with their hard-earned cash and buy a small library's worth of novels, essays and poems. But when the books fail to arrive, they soon begin to wonder if he is really a conman.

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: John-Boy agrees to work for a local man in exchange for a car, but ends up being taken for a ride when the scoundrel reneges on the deal.

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.desc: Anthrax strikes Walnut Grove, so Charles and Mr Garvey visit Springfield to pick up medical supplies. On the way back, a man holds them up and steals their wagon.

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.desc: Terminally ill Dylan Whittaker's greatest wish is to see the ocean, and he seeks Albert's help in fulfilling his dream before he dies.

programme.title: Providence
programme.desc: Donna and Robbie make plans to disrupt Heather and Charlie's wedding and Syd helps an apparently destitute man, little suspecting he is a cunning con artist. Mike Farrell stars.

programme.title: Providence
programme.desc: A storm hits Providence, while Syd's medical practice faces problems as a leaky roof interferes with her efforts to save the life of a pregnant woman.

programme.title: Highway to Heaven
programme.desc: A man tries to persuade his neighbours to help him build a memorial to his son, who was killed in the Vietnam war. Eli Wallach guest stars.

programme.title: Highway to Heaven
programme.desc: Mark believes he is responsible for two tragedies, and pleads with Jonathan to change history.

programme.title: Daniel's Daughter
programme.desc: A magazine editor receives news of her estranged father's death, and agrees to fulfil his final wish to scatter his ashes at the family's old home, an undertaking forces her to confront the past she left behind. Drama, starring Laura Leighton, London Angelis, Martin Doyle, Brandon Firla and Dorly Jean-Louis.

programme.title: Saigon, Year of the Cat
programme.desc: A British banker working in Saigon during the last days of the Vietnam war becomes increasingly attracted to a CIA operative, and the ensuing affair gives her an insight into how out of their depth the American forces really are. Stephen Frears' romantic drama, starring Judi Dench, Frederic Forrest, Roger Rees, Wallace Shawn, Josef Sommer and EG Marshall.

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: John and Olivia must accept that Erin is growing up when GW Haines proposes marriage. However, when she turns down her boyfriend's proposal, GW elects to join the army.

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.desc: Laura is attracted to a new boy in school, but Nellie is equally keen on him, and plans to ruin their romance.

programme.title: No One Would Tell
programme.desc: A shy teenager thinks all her dreams have come true when the school's star athlete asks her out. However, the relationship soon turns sour as her seemingly perfect boyfriend becomes possessive, controlling and violent. Drama, starring Fred Savage, Candace Cameron Bure, Gregory Alan Williams and Rodney Eastman.

programme.title: Vanished Without a Trace
programme.desc: A distraught mother swears to exact an appropriate revenge on the thug responsible for kidnapping and killing her teenage daughter. Crime drama, starring Shelley Long, William R Moses and Jennifer Jostyn.

programme.title: Joan of Arc
programme.desc: Conclusion of the epic adventure. In the heat of battle the French heroine is captured, and sold to the English enemy. Conclusion of the epic adventure, starring Leelee Sobieski, Jacqueline Bissett, Powers Boothe, Olympia Dukakis, Shirley MacLaine and Peter O'Toole.

programme.title: This Sporting Life
programme.desc: A successful rugby league player's arrogant and aggressive behaviour undermines his fragile relationship with an emotionally repressed widow. As their affair comes to a bitter end, he devotes himself to the game, but the exploitation he and his fellow players endure takes its toll. Lindsay Anderson's drama, starring Richard Harris, Rachel Roberts, Alan Badel, William Hartnell, Colin Blakely and Arthur Lowe.

programme.title: Taggart
programme.desc: A gambler is found kicked to death - and despite the fact that he was unemployed, the team find wads of cash hidden in his flat. programme.title: The Waltons

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.desc: Part two of two. Charlie makes a mistake as Laura and Nellie continue their battle to win the affections of Almanzo Wilder. Drama, starring Michael Landon.(n)

programme.title: Providence
programme.desc: The Hansen clan throw a surprise party for Jim's 60th birthday and try to talk him out of retiring while Syd is asked to perform ritual surgery so a man can convert to Judaism.(n)

programme.title: Providence
programme.desc: Robbie fills in for Heather at the clinic and Syd attempts to bring about a reconcilation between a pregnant woman and her estranged family.(n)

programme.title: Highway to Heaven
programme.desc: Jonathan reunites a woman with the son she was forced to abandon in Russia during the Second World War - but he questions the angel's motives for wanting to help them.(n)

programme.title: Highway to Heaven
programme.desc: A survivor of the Holocaust is forced to relive his past when he and his grandson are attacked by a neo-Nazi gang.(n)

programme.title: Too Young to Marry

The couple remain determined to carve out a successful life for themselves, but when Jessica is accepted at Harvard University, she faces a dilemma. Romantic drama, starring Nina Dobrev and Dillon Casey.(n)

programme.title: The Wronged Man
programme.desc: A lawyer develops an interest in the case of a man sentenced to life imprisonment for rape, and comes to believe that he is innocent. programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: Part one of two. Mary Ellen prepares to give birth, and Jason encounters financial difficulties that force him to look for work elsewhere.(n)

programme.title: Romy And Michele's High School Reunion
programme.desc: Romy (Mira Sorvino) and Michele (Lisa Kudrow) are carefree party girls who reinvent themselves for their 10-year high school reunion. With new wardrobes and wild stories of success, they make a big impression, until a former classmate (Janeane Garofalo) blabs their real story to everyone! But that's when Romy and Michele let loose with a surprise of their own to outrageous results.

programme.title: Bridget Jones: The Edge of Reason
programme.desc: Just when Bridget thinks life is perfect, her relationship with the dreamy Mark Darcy implodes. She sets off on a whirlwind business trip to Thailand where she encounters old flame Daniel Cleaver, and her life gets out-of-control.

programme.title: Dean
programme.desc: Demetri Martin plays an illustrator who falls hard for an LA woman (Gillian Jacobs) while trying to prevent his father (Kevin Kline) from selling the family home in the wake of his mother's death.

programme.title: Jimmy Neutron: Boy Genius
programme.desc: A ten-year-old genius inventor must rally his neighborhood pals to build an armada of spaceships and rescue their parents from a goopy alien race in time for dinner in this computer-animated box office blockbuster from Nickelodeon. Featuring the voices of Martin Short, Andrea Martin and Patrick Stewart.

programme.title: Pirates of the Caribbean: Dead Man's Chest
programme.desc: Captain Jack Sparrow has a blood debt to pay. He owes his soul to the ghastly Davy Jones unless he can cheat death - and eternal damnation - by seizing the fabled Dead Man's Chest. Johnny Depp, Orlando Bloom and Keira Knightley star.

programme.title: Steel Magnolias
programme.desc: A wedding is about to take place in Chinquapin, Louisiana. The bride is Shelby (Julia Roberts), a headstrong young beauty whose iron-willed mother, M'Lynn (Sally Field), would do anything for her. Giant-haired Dolly Parton is Truvy, the owner of the beauty parlor that serves as the town's unofficial hub. Dropping in to exchange gossip are Ouiser (Shirley MacLaine), the richest and meanest woman in town, and Clairee (Olympia Dukakis), an elegant widow with a sly delivery. Together they provide each other with strength and friendship.

programme.title: The Big Chill
programme.desc: Seven college housemates from the 1960s who have drifted apart must now reunite for the funeral of a friend. Having entered adulthood as non-conformists, most now belong to the establishment. Harold (Kevin Kline) has grown up to be a running-shoe magnate; Michael (Jeff Goldblum), a gossip magazine journalist; Sam (Tom Berenger), TV's hottest private eye; and Nick (William Hurt), a drug dealer. Among the women, Sarah (Glenn Close) is a doctor; Meg (Mary Kay Place), a lawyer; and Karen (Jobeth Williams), a wife and mother in the suburbs.

programme.title: The Girl On The Train
programme.desc: Rachel, who is devastated by her recent divorce, spends her daily commute fantasizing about the seemingly perfect couple who live in a house that her train passes every day. One morning she sees something shocking happen there and becomes entangled in the mystery that unfolds. Emily Blunt, Lisa Kudrow, Justin Theroux and Allison Janney star.

programme.title: Pirates of the Caribbean: Dead Man's Chest
programme.desc: Captain Jack Sparrow has a blood debt to pay. He owes his soul to the ghastly Davy Jones unless he can cheat death - and eternal damnation - by seizing the fabled Dead Man's Chest. Johnny Depp, Orlando Bloom and Keira Knightley star.

programme.title: Ghost in the Shell
programme.desc: In the near future, Major (Scarlett Johansson) is the first of her kind - a human saved from a terrible crash, who is cyber-enhanced to be a perfect soldier devoted to stopping the world's most dangerous criminals. Terrorism has reached a new level that includes the ability to hack into people's minds and control them, but Major is uniquely qualified to stop it. As she prepares to face a new enemy, Major discovers that she has been lied to: her life was not saved, it was stolen. Now she must figure out who created her.

programme.title: Inglourious Basterds
programme.desc: A squadron of vengeful, Nazi-killing Allied soldiers becomes embroiled in a plot to firebomb a Parisian movie theater hosting a film premiere that Adolf Hitler plans to attend in this comically violent World War II action smash starring Brad Pitt, Diane Kruger and Oscar® winner Christoph Waltz.
